textos_fuente.text: About Us | Diabetes Management | Pops Diabetes Care Home Partners Individuals Caregivers About FAQ Tutorials Blog Contact Us üìû  (800) 767-7268 Login Partners Individuals Caregivers About FAQ Blog Meet Mina Login About Us Pops Diabetes was founded in May of 2013 by Lonny Stormo, Dan Davis, and Curt Christensen. The concept of Pops was created while Lonny and the co-founders were catching fish in the middle of a remote lake in Minnesota. While watching Dan reel in a large walleye while trying to check his blood sugar with a traditional testing kit, Lonny asked the group, ‚ÄúWhy can‚Äôt I use my phone to check my blood sugar while I‚Äôm out fishing or jogging? This kit hasn‚Äôt changed in the 20 years I‚Äôve been using it and only shows me one result at a time. It‚Äôs frustrating.‚Äù They hooked that idea and went back to the shop where they engineered a simple, all-in-one meter that connects wirelessly to an app on a phone ‚Äì showing weekly and monthly trends at the touch of a button. Pops was founded with the intent of putting simple technology in people‚Äôs hands to enable them to Own Their Life¬Æ. What We Do Value relationships Talk about our golf game Resolve roadblocks Play Old Town Road on repeat Challenge the status quo What We Don‚Äôt Work > life Hidden agendas Resist chocolate Fax Wear khakis Pops' Values The Experience is Everything: We are committed to inspiring our clients and owners by providing a simple and consumer focused approach to diabetes management. We work to solve their daily challenges, understand their pain points, and to go above and beyond in serving them. Make Change Happen: To be the leader, we need to dream big, and we use our strengths to invent, tinker, engineer, imagine, inspire, design, create, and trailblaze our dreams into actionable change. Be a Good Human: We show up as real, vulnerable, transparent human beings who speak from the heart, value others‚Äô contributions, and invest in each other‚Äôs growth. We operate as a tight-knit unit that creates a culture of well-being and support for one another. Pops Leadership Team Click on image to read more. Have you ever stood in the middle of a city and wondered why did the first person settle here and what made this city grow? Lonny loves blending history, trends, and strategy for his historical and nerdy curiosity (driving his family nuts) and in looking at why trends and businesses fail and succeed. Lonny Stormo CEO Dr. Timothy Balder, MD has over 40 years of experience in the medical field as a Family Medicine Specialist. He graduated from the University of Minnesota Medical School in 1985. Timothy Balder, MD Chief Medical Officer Janet is passionate about improving processes in all aspects of life‚Äîboth at work and at home.  As an Industrial Engineer, Six-Sigma Greenbelt, and career Operations Leader, she thrives on driving organization, efficiency, and quality.  At home she enjoys honing her cooking and entertaining skills and learning about all aspects of food and wine. Janet Stormo VP Operations Kevin leads our business development. Kevin is passionate about finding and partnering with clients who can benefit the most from Pops. He has worked with multiple startups to create and grow their business. Kevin has more than eight years of experience in business development and angel investing. Kevin Lunke Business Development Manager Dan loves to tackle complex problems with science and engineering. He also has an extensive tackle box as an avid fisherman. His favorite fish is walleye fried in butter. You can often find Dan jogging around scenic Stillwater, playing with his grandkids or fishing in the middle of a remote lake. Dan Davis VP R&D & Security Officer Curt enjoys learning how things work and then making them better and is an avid DIYer with endless home projects. He enjoys traveling to see new places and having new adventures. Curt Christensen VP Manufacturing Let‚Äôs Do This Choose your adventure below. For Individuals Partners Pops Tools Products Individuals Portal Caregiver Portal Company About Blog Careers Investors Resources FAQ Contact Us Stay up to Date! First Name First Last Email Address * *By signing up, you agree to receive newsletters, announcements, and other goodness. Contact Us Phone: Support + 1 (800) 767-7268 Email: General [email¬†protected] Support [email¬†protected] Locations: Minneapolis, MN Sunnyvale, CA Copyright ¬© 2020 - 2025 Pops Diabetes Care, Inc.               $ | Zimbabwe Search Log in Cart We're Open! Milk teas, smoothies, Asian street food, and more! Get ready to sip, savor, and indulge this  2025! üåûü•§ From creamy Milk Teas to refreshing Smoothies, and a tantalizing array of Asian Street Food delights, our menu promises a culinary journey like no other. Fruit Tea Experience the burst of refreshing flavors in every sip of our fruit teas. Infused with a delightful blend of natural fruits, each cup offers a unique and invigorating taste adventure, customizable with bobas, jellies, or even jam. Pop Culture Merch Indulge in our exclusive collection of pop culture merch, meticulously designed by us. Grab yours in-store while you savor your favorite drink! Don't miss out on this perfect blend of style and refreshment. Asian Street Food Immerse yourself in the vibrant flavors of Asian street food with our delectable offerings! Savor the crispy perfection of Goyza, delight in the fresh and crunchy spring rolls, and explore a variety of other mouthwatering treats. Each bite promises a burst of authentic taste, bringing the bustling streets of Asia to your plate. Bubble Pops The Store FAQ's Q.	Tell us about Bubble Pops A.	We are a social hub where the atmosphere is electric, the drinks are refreshing, and the snacks are downright delicious. Our space is decked out with trendy pop culture merchandise like Labubus and more! We know you're here for more than just the amazing drinks‚Äîyou‚Äôre here for the vibe and those Instagram-worthy snaps! And guess what? We're the only place in Central FL where you can sip on Boba Cocktails! Come for the fun, stay for the memories! Q.	What are your store hours and locations? A.	Our very first location is in sunny St. Cloud, FL, just a hop, skip, and a jump away from Orlando and Kissimmee! üå¥‚ú® üïí Hours of Fun: Sun-Thurs: 11AM - 10PM Fri & Sat: 11AM - Midnight üìç Find Us Here: 4533 Old Canoe Creek Rd. Saint Cloud, FL 32769 Q.	What types of boba tea do you offer? A.	Get ready to dive into a world of deliciousness with our amazing boba tea selection! From classic milk teas and refreshing fruit teas to zesty lemonades, creamy smoothies, and aromatic coffee, there's something for everyone. Don't miss out on our fun signature drinks like SWIFTEA, YODABOBA, and PURPLE RAIN! Plus, for those 21 and over, we've got a fantastic range of beer and cocktails to add a little extra sparkle to your day. Come sip, savor, and enjoy! üåüüçπüßã Q.	Will you have snacks or food available? A.	Absolutely! We offer a delicious selection of Asian street food, including mouthwatering Takoyaki, savory Gyoza, and crispy Spring Rolls. Come take your taste buds on a delightful adventure! Q.	Can I buy merch from your online store (Mybubblepops.com) but at the St. Cloud store? A.	We've got an awesome array of pop culture goodies that will keep you coming back for more. Our collection is always fresh and fun, with new items rotating in regularly. Q.	What sets this store apart from other boba tea shops? A.	Experience a tea spot like no other! At our place, we blend pop culture with a dash of fun. Forget the quiet, traditional tea scene ‚Äì here, you‚Äôll find lively music, exciting games, and a calendar packed with special events like Themed Bingo and Trivia Nights. And did we mention our Boba Cocktails? Sip, play, and celebrate with us! Q.	Can you host birthday parties, group outings or events? A.	üéâ Yes, we have an awesome birthday package! üéâ Whether you're planning a private event, team outing, or a fun-filled birthday bash, we've got you covered! Let us know what you're dreaming of, and we'll make it a reality. Drop us a line at INFO@MYBUBBLEPOPS.COM for all the details. Let's make your celebration unforgettable! üéà‚ú® Q.	Do you offer vegan or dairy-free options? A.	Yep, we've got you covered with vegan and dairy-free options galore! From non-dairy milk alternatives to delicious fruit tea drinks (and snacks), there's something for everyone. And guess what? Boba itself is totally vegan! Swing by and chat with our awesome staff for all the tasty details! Q.	Is there Wi-Fi available at the store? A.	We‚Äôve got free Wi-Fi for all our awesome customers. So, bring your laptop or tablet, sip on your boba tea, and let the productivity party begin! Q.	Do you have any loyalty or rewards programs? A.	Yes, please see staff!  We use Clover app for rewards during checkout. Q.	Can I customize my drink? A.	Dive into the fun of customizing your drink! Pick your favorite tea base, decide how sweet you want it, choose your milk, and go wild with add-ons like boba, jellies, and so much more. Make every sip your own unique creation! Q.	How can I stay updated on new products and events? A.	Follow us on our social media channels for the latest updates on new products, events, and special promotions. Q.	Are pets allowed in the store? A.	Service animals are welcome! Q.	Do you offer any gluten-free options? A.	Yes, we have a selection of gluten-free snacks and drinks available. Please ask our staff for more details when you visit. Q.	Is there parking available? A.	Yes, we have ample parking available for our customers at the St. Cloud location. Q.	Do you have a lost and found? A.	Yes, if you‚Äôve lost something at our store, please contact our staff or email INFO@MYBUBBLEPOPS.COM with a description of the item. Q.	What forms of payment do you accept? A.	We accept all major credit cards, debit cards, and mobile payments such as Apple Pay and Google Wallet. About Us - Bubble EnterprisesBubble Enterprises Bubble Enterprises Community Interest Company Where good ideas become great enterprises Associates Services Brands Associates Partnership Consulting Enterprises Education Cafes Pods Projects Blog About Our Inspirations Our Academics Our Faith Leaders Contact About Us Bubble Enterprises specialises in delivering skills and knowledge to startups and spin-off ventures. Based in Greater Manchester, we work with clients across the North West of England and beyond ‚Äì from individuals and organisations of all kinds in the third sector to commercial companies requiring entrepreneurial expertise. ‚ÄúWhether it‚Äôs equipping you with business skills or growth strategies, we will work with you and your organisation to turn your idea into a profitable business.‚Äù Our startup story Like all businesses, Bubble started life as an idea. A trio of business professionals with experience in running our own ventures, the Bubble founders came up with an idea to create a business incubator providing early stage business support to individuals and organisations. Throughout our careers we‚Äôd witnessed firsthand just how beneficial business support can be for startups. We wanted to be instrumental in helping fledgling ventures stay in business for the long term. In 2001 we approached Manchester Business School with our idea and soon after, we successfully launched Manchester Business School‚Äôs Incubator and our business, Bubble Partnership. We quickly realised that entrepreneurial skill sets could also be applied within communities, providing opportunities for individuals on the margins of society to take control of their own futures. This led to the creation of sister business Bubble Enterprises CIC and the Bubble Enterprise Engagement Programme ‚Äì an initiative aimed at budding entrepreneurs and startups facing significant challenges. Since the programme started out, we‚Äôve helped more than 1,750 people explore enterprise opportunities, with many going on to start their own businesses. We‚Äôre passionate about making a difference to communities ‚Äì both economically and socially, which is why we commit to work with many of our entrepreneurs and organisations throughout the life of their business. Share this: Meet our people Dr Leigh Wharton ‚Äì Director Leigh is a founding Director of both Bubble Partnership Ltd and Bubble Enterprises CIC. He specialises in providing consultancy services for high-growth clients, as well as supporting individuals and organisations starting or developing new business ventures. Areas of expertise range from preparing companies for market entry and assisting with initial sales to helping businesses maximise investment and growth. Leigh is a Fellow of the Royal Society of Arts (RSA), Manufacture and Commerce and a former member of the North West Development Agency Business Angels Network advisory team, which provided guidance and support services for entrepreneurs seeking informal investment. Previous clients include Jepson Holt Ltd, Pixie Children‚Äôs Wear Ltd, UK Plumbing Supplies (Finagold Ltd), Ask A Price LLP, Gentry Grooming Company Ltd, Stringsta Ltd and Martin Conquest Ltd. Belinda Barnard ‚Äì Director Belinda heads up Bubble‚Äôs cafes and catering operation. The cafes utilise the skills of people with mental health difficulties by providing employment and volunteering opportunities, demonstrating Bubble‚Äôs ethos of providing sustainable opportunities for social and economic inclusion. Previously, Belinda was Managing Director and joint founder of Mica (UK) Ltd, a company which followed a worldwide model of group branding and marketing for independent hardware retailers, which grew to 200 member stores nationwide, with retail sales in excess of ¬£65 million. Some of the clients Belinda has worked with include Jepson Holt Ltd, Pixie Children‚Äôs Wear Ltd, UK Plumbing Supplies (Finagold Ltd), Ask A Price LLP, Gentry Grooming Company Ltd, Stringsta Ltd and Martin Conquest Ltd Don Phillips ‚Äì Director and Chair Don has served as Chairman of Bubble Enterprises since 2007 and is a Non-Executive Director, Consultant and Coach. He has built his experience over 30 years in leadership roles at the cutting edge of the IT industry, working previously for Hewlett-Packard Ltd, Arrow ECS Ltd, Kavanagh Systems Ltd and Theorem Solutions Ltd. Having also founded, developed and sold intellectual property through his own business Lloyd-Davies Associates Ltd, Don has developed a broad skill set in corporate governance, sales, marketing and operations, underpinned by an extensive knowledge and practical experience of implementing IT systems and processes. Don takes a keen interest in exploring how sustainable social enterprise and entrepreneurship ‚Äì particularly alliances with the commercial world ‚Äì can help mental health service users aid their recovery and achieve social and economic inclusion. He also serves as a Lay-Member for lived experience and public engagement on the board of Stockports NHS Clinical Commissioning Group. Katherine Harrington - Catering Manager Katherine brings a wealth of experience to the catering operations at Bubble‚Äôs cafes, having worked in restaurants, schools and contract catering over an extensive career. Katherine has an HND in hotel catering and institutional management and an ONC in hotel catering and institutional operations. She is also a member of the Institute of Hospitality. Bubble Pops with St. Cloud Cops happens on Friday, Sept. 27 from 7-8:30 p.m. at Bubble Pops, 4525 Old Canoe Creek Road. X Body Get to know your local law enforcement and attend these fun community outreach events! Bubble Pops with St. Cloud Cops happens on Friday, Sept. 27 from 7-8:30 p.m. at Bubble Pops, 4525 Old Canoe Creek Road. The St. Cloud Police Department is hosting this informal yet informative night of ‚ÄúBoba and Banter‚Äù with the Community Engagement Team. National Night Out is an annual community building campaign that promotes police and community partnerships with neighborhood camaraderie. The St. Cloud Police Department invites the community to join them for an evening of games and activities, safety presentations, live DJ, food trucks, touch a truck display and more. This free event will be held at the St. Cloud Lakefront Park, on Tuesday, Oct. 1 from 4-7 p.m. Did you know that Wednesday, Oct. 2 is National Coffee with a Cop Day? Celebrate with the St. Cloud PD day at Vanessa‚Äôs Coffee Shop, (3350 Canoe Creek Road) from 9-11 a.m. Chief Douglas Goerke and members of the St. Cloud Police Department with the Community Engagement Unit are hosting this informal meeting and will answer questions and hear concerns. Osceola Community Health Services will bring its Medical Mobile Unit to the Narcoossee Community Park, 5354 Rambling Road, on Saturday, Sept. 28 from 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. This event is for residents of St. Cloud and nearby areas, is free and includes blood glucose testing and blood pressure monitoring. The St. Cloud Womens Club‚Äôs Ninth Annual Craft Show, which is a scholarship fundraiser, will be on Saturday, Sept. 28th from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. at the St. Cloud Community Center. Vendors include jewelry, home d√©cor, cakes, wreaths, purses and more. There will also be a 50/50 raffle and door prizes. Concessions include hot dogs, beverage and snack stand. For vendor info contact, Linda Lokken at 407-569-7688. The Women‚Äôs Club of St. Cloud is welcome to all! Meetings are at 12 noon the third Wednesday of every month at the St. Cloud Womens‚Äô Club building (1012 Massachusetts Ave). E.S.O.L. for Beginners allows others to become more familiar with the English language. This class will be held at the St. Cloud Library on Friday, Sept. 27 from 10-11:30 a.m. Gardening Series: Gardening in Small Backyards takes place on Monday, Sept. 30th from 11 a.m. to 12 noon. Bring the joy of gardening to you by learning tricks and how to create a beautiful garden in small spaces. This series is presented by UF/IFAS Extension. Central Florida Business Networking Group shares ideas and opportunities with fellow professionals representing a variety of different local businesses. This group will meet at the Library on Tuesday, Oct. 1 from 9-10:30 a.m. A.I. for Seniors and Beginners will be at the Library on Tuesday, Oct. 1st from 1011 a.m. Presented by Professor Adam Simon, this class will teach about artificial intelligence and how it can be used in everyday life for information. The St. Cloud Library is located at 810 13th St. All Library programs are free and open to the public. Hometown Harvest at Sunbridge is open to the public and takes place on Saturday, Oct. 5 from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. at 6197 Cyrils Dr. The Harvest features a live country band, tractor pull hayrides to Pioneer Park, a pumpkin decorating station, petting zoo, food vendors, photo ops and more. The Rotary Club of St. Cloud presents Casino Cash Bash on Saturday, Oct. 12 from 5-9 p.m. The $75 ticket, which is a donation, includes access to a variety of casino games including blackjack, poker, roulette and more. Tickets also include a stash of casino chips, cash prize drawings and hors d‚Äôoeuvres. Casino Cash Bash will be held at the St. Cloud VFW Post 3227, 915 New York Ave. The proceeds from this event fund local projects within the community. For more information, email events@rotaryclubofstcloudfl.org.
